name: The Sunset Social
description:
Join us for an unforgettable evening of connections and conversations. This is your chance to mix and mingle with startups, entrepreneurs, and innovators from across industries in a relaxed, inspiring atmosphere. We are officially part of Toronto Tech Week 2025, a weeklong citywide collection of events to connect and celebrate the builders. June 23 to June 27, 2025.

Whether you're looking to spark new collaborations, grow your network, or simply unwind with like-minded peers, this event offers the perfect setting to connect over good food, great wine, and meaningful conversation.

name: Community Pride: Native Plant Diversity in High Park

location.name: High Park Nature Centre Forest School

description:
Note: Pre-registration is required for all our events, hikes and workshops. We do this to ensure we don't exceed our capacity for indoor events or the maximum limits for group sizes on High Park's ecologically sensitive trails. 

Discover the vibrant world of native plants through a queer lens! Join Ryan Godfrey for an interactive walk exploring the resilience, adaptability, and interconnections of native species—and how they reflect diverse 2SLGBTQQIA+experiences. Through storytelling, ecology, and history, we'll celebrate nature's fluidity and the power of community.

The Community Pride event is open to everyone! Whether you're a plant lover or just curious, this event invites you to see the natural world in a whole new way.

name: How the Americans Ruined Dinner Walking Tour

location.name: Start Point - Fort Rouillé Monument near Scadding Cabin at Exhibition Place

description:
Dive into the Battle of York in which American invaders occupied the town of York during the War of 1812. Explore the reasons for the invasion, the state of York's defences, the course of the battle and why it ruined Elizabeth Powell's dinner party. We'll also take a look at what this area was like in 1813 and how the American occupation shaped the development of the future city of Toronto.

This 4.0 kilometre-long tour was developed and will be led by Adam Waiser. Adam is a history enthusiast and co-host of the Muddy York history podcast. The podcast has been operating for nearly two years and their mission is to tell Toronto stories and inform listeners about what the GTA was like before the year 2000.

name: Sun, Sand and Innovation - Networking Social and Mixer
description:
A premier beachside networking social for entrepreneurs and investors in tech, real estate, and crypto. Connect with like-minded professionals in a relaxed, sun-soaked setting, where conversations flow as easily as the waves. Whether you're looking to expand your network, explore new ventures, or just enjoy a day of sun and synergy, this event is for you!

​We are officially part of Toronto Tech Week 2025, a weeklong citywide collection of events to connect and celebrate the builders from June 23 - June 27, 2025,.

name: Giggles Pride Comedy Show
description:
Kick off Pride Weekend not with glitter but with opinions presented hilariously. Hosted by the ever angelic, partner in crime Adrienne Fish from Just For Laughs and CraveTV, this is a show so big that we needed three headliners, the infamous Ava Val from Just for Laughs and Crave TV, Courtney Gilmour from Canada's Got Talent and Just For Laughs and Juno Award-nominee Jess Salomon from Baroness Von Sketch.

Supported by Up and Comers Anasimone George from TedX, and Bee Bertrand from Just For Laughs.
